name: 3.15 "King of the Hill" Quiz | 'Cheers'- Season 3 | 10 Questions

questions.correct: a crock of beer and a snorkle
options: a keg of beer and a huge glass
a pint of beer and a straw
questions.explanation:
a crock of beer and a snorkle.

	Norm once again had a witty response to the question, "What can I get you?". Norm's favorite pasttime is drinking beer at Cheers.

questions.text: Where did Diane suggest Norm take his mother-in-law?
questions.explanation:
Bunker Hill.

	Norm has lived in Boston for many years and has no idea about the rich cultural history of the city. Diane couldn't believe he was so clueless.

questions.text: Why did Coach find it hard to get to Fenway?
questions.explanation:
He kept getting lost.

	Fenway is the baseball stadium for the Boston Red Sox. Coach used to be the third base coach for the Red Sox on the show.

questions.text: What did Sam play in this episode?
questions.explanation:
softball.

	Sam was a relief pitcher for the Boston Red Sox before he bought Cheers. He was pitching again for charity but this time in a softball game.

questions.text: What did Sam say was the only thing he'd thrown in the last 10 years?
questions.correct: Diane's butt out of the bar
options: a tantrum when the Red Sox lost
questions.explanation:
Diane's butt out of the bar.

	Everyone in the bar is sick of Sam and Diane's constant fighting over who dumped whom and who likes whom. Diane replied, "you're thinking of the tantrum you threw when I walked out of here."

Playboy Playmates.

	This was a charity game. Normally Sam wouldn't do charity games but when he found out who he'd be pitching against he agreed.

Yes.

	Sam was happy he won. The gang however was not happy with him.

questions.text: Why were the men upset with Sam?
questions.correct: They wanted to watch the Playmates run around the baseball field.
options: They thought Sam was a bad sport.
They had money on the game.
questions.explanation:
They wanted to watch the Playmates run around the baseball field.

	Sam had planned to let the women win. However, when he got on the field he became very competitive.

questions.text: What did Diane say was Sam's one character flaw?
options: He was still obsessed with Diane
questions.explanation:
He can't stand to lose.

	Sam claimed that he did not have a problem losing. Diane then pointed out he gave up any shot he had with the Playboy Playmates just to win.

questions.text: What game did Sam and Diane play?
questions.explanation:
ping pong.

	Sam claimed Diane couldn't stand to lose. They start playing the game to prove that they can lose but then neither of them can handle the idea of losing.
